DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterion Lumbar thoracolumbar Adult Deformity require posterior spinal instrumentation fusion like : Scoliosis Kyphosis Kyphoscoliosis Patient Cobb angle ≥ 30° and/or confirm sagittal imbalance define sagittal vertical axis ( SVA ) equal 5cm and/or loss lumbar lordosis versus pelvic incidence Patient ≥ 21 year old Surgery require 4 level operate Patient complete preoperative radiographic data : anteroposterior lateral stand full spine xrays ( hip C2 ) lateral bending xrays ( stand ) Patient able complete selfadministered questionnaire Patient able sign consent form Exclusion criterion Patient operate posterior spinal fusion without PASS LP device Patients require Vertebral Column Resection technique surgery Neuromuscular scoliosis disease neurorelated pathology Spinal cord abnormalities neurologic symptom sign Primary abnormality bone ( e.g . osteogenesis imperfecta ) Recent significant trauma Patient involve current medical litigation Metabolic spinal pathology Pathologic obesity ( BMI > 40 ) Patients infection ( particularly osteomyelitis ) Patient < 21 year old Pregnancy intend get pregnant next 3 year Insulindependent diabetes All contraindication give PASS® LP System instruction use Patient unable sign inform consent form Patient unable complete selfadministered questionnaire
